meanings.definition: Move or swing back and forth in a signal or gesture.
meanings.sent1: The flag was wigwagging in the wind.
meanings.sent2: The conductor was wigwagging his baton to keep the orchestra in time.
meanings.sent3: The scarecrow's arms were wigwagging comically in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: The pendulum of the old clock was wigwagging steadily.
meanings.sent5: The dog's tail was wigwagging happily as it greeted its owner.

meanings.definition: Communicate by moving back and forth in a signal or gesture.
meanings.sent1: The lighthouse was wigwagging a warning to ships at sea.
meanings.sent2: The friends were wigwagging their hands to each other from across the street.
meanings.sent3: The mime was wigwagging imaginary objects in the air.
meanings.sent4: The branches of the tree were wigwagging in the storm, signaling danger.
meanings.sent5: The dancer was wigwagging her arms gracefully during the performance.
